channel.title: My new computer is finished! EDIT: UPDATED!
channel.description:
The computer i've been working on for a few months is finally done. Just waiting for all parts to arrive and assemble, then i'll take some pictures.
Specs:
Motherboard: Biostar TA790GX A2+ PSU: Cooler Master Silent Pro M 600W 135mm Ultra silent CPU: AMD Phenom II X4 920 (125W, AM2+, 8MB Cache, 2,8Ghz) Memory: Corsair Dominator XMS2 TWIN2X4096-8500C5 2x2GB (tot. 4GB) DDR2 PC2-8500 1066MHz x2 (8gb ram) HDD 1: My 2 year old IDE 320GB (no point upgrading when i have a fully functional hdd) HDD 2: My 4 year old IDE 120GB (backup-hdd) External HDD: Buffalo 1TB USB 2.0 External Hard Drive (for storing all my goodies) GFX Card: XFX Geforce GTX 275 OC 896MB Chassi: Cooler Master Centurion 534+ Sound Card: Sound Blaster Audigy 2 Platinum w/ front-bay (A bit old, but still a great sound card) DVDRW: Some cheap $50 drive from local computer store (works fine for xbox360 games which was my main reason for buying it)
Price: Not really sure as i bought these parts from time to time, and some at really low prices, estimated cost is $1,459.00 USD
Opinions on this build please, i expect it to last for at least a few years before i need an upgrade.
EDIT: Replaced GFX cards and PSU.
Picture: [img]http://i26.tinypic.com/radetz.jpg[/img]

item.title: My new computer is finished! EDIT: UPDATED!
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“TheBeanie, post:25, topic:270293”]might wanna consider getting a more powerfull PSU, When i built my comp it said the maximum mine can use is 550w… Yours looks like its got more stuff then mine.[/quote]The output is really 720 watts max, however you wouldn’t need more than a 600 watts psu even for 3-4 gtx 295’s really (assuming it’s a high quality psu with good ampere output on the rails)

Read full topic
item.source: My new computer is finished! EDIT: UPDATED!

item.title: My new computer is finished! EDIT: UPDATED!
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

Mopman:

The quality of the PSU is way more important than the arbitrary wattage they stamp on the box, however bear in mind it will degrade over time, I dread to think how shit my probably-nearly-10-year-old psu is performing now

Yes, like all hardware look for a good manufacturer (basically something not off-brand).

Read full topic

item.title: My new computer is finished! EDIT: UPDATED!
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:22, topic:270293”][quote author=runescape3dude link=topic=356737.msg2874521#msg2874521 date=1247968174]

[quote author=Speljohan link=topic=356737.msg2873974#msg2873974 date=1247943289]

yarly your cables are all over the place :rolleyes:

But, it’s a really nice pc stats wise.

That’s what’s inside any computer, lots of things in it.

Nice computer, my dad knows how to make one from scratch, he could teach me how sometime.

I know what’s inside a computer, but mine are just a lot more… Organized >_>
[/quote]I don’t have any cable clips so ye

Watch out that the cables do not get into the CPU fan, it sounds like shit when that happens.
[/quote]They don’t.[/quote]
Ok, that sometimes happens to me when I move my PC around and I am like “WTF!?!?”

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:9, topic:270293”][quote author=xEnt link=topic=356737.msg2730169#msg2730169 date=1238648217]

Speljohan:

4890? Sounds interesting, maybe i should sell my xfire 4850’s and purchase a pair of 4890’s when they come instead

Just came out.

newegg.com

4890 - Newegg.com

Newegg.com offers the best prices on computer products, laptop computers, LED LCD TVs, digital cameras, electronics, unlocked phones, office supplies, and more with fast shipping and top-rated customer service. Newegg shopping upgraded ™

Amazing, 850mhz stock core clock, OC’s to 1ghz on air (first card at 1ghz), 1GB DDR5 3.9ghz mem clock, this card is a fucking beast for 250$ ATI win
[/quote]That’s really fucking cheap. I shall consider a couple of those![/quote]
wait a few weeks for the GTX275 to come out, prices are rumored to drop to 219$ on the 4890s

item.title: My new computer is finished! EDIT: UPDATED!
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

[quote=“runescape3dude, post:6, topic:270293”]what is so good about a sound card compared to onboard sound?

Would it help the frame rate at all in GTAIV if I install a sound card?[/quote]No, pairing good speakers (lets take the logitech z5500’s for example) with onboard generic sound, will sound alright. Pairing it with decent audigy card or anything else high end, will sound clear as fuck.

Read full topic

item.title: My new computer is finished! EDIT: UPDATED!
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:4, topic:270293”][quote author=xEnt link=topic=356737.msg2727759#msg2727759 date=1238486069]
very nice build, except toss the IDE hdd’s, buy a 60$ 500gig sata-II hdd. Or grab ur self a veloci raptor 320gig if you have the money.

The build i’m currently working on is

AMD Phenom II 940 (3ghz)
6GB OCZ Reapers DDR3 1800mhz
ATI Radeon 4890 1GB (When it comes out, month or 2)
Patriot 32GB SSD + 640GB WD HDD
ASUS M4A79T Deluxe Mobo

[/quote]4890? Sounds interesting, maybe i should sell my xfire 4850’s and purchase a pair of 4890’s when they come instead.

And about the harddrives, it doesn’t really bother me that they are IDE. I don’t notice any performance boost from using SATA as i’ve used some of those disks before.[/quote]
fuckin rich cunt, how about you send me your 4850s, so i can trade them to someone for a 4890.

Read full topic
